factoid: The countess hid her face on her daughter's breast.

Natásha now grew more agitated and impatient every day.

After Prince Andrew's engagement to Natásha, Pierre felt it impossible to go on living as before.
Pierre was firmly convinced of the truths revealed to him by his benefactor.
Pierre was happy as he had been in perfecting his inner man.
Pierre had devoted himself to his inner man with such ardor.
The zest of Pierre's life vanished after the engagement of Andrew and Natásha and the death of Joseph Alexéevich.
The news of Joseph Alexéevich's death reached Pierre almost at the same time as the engagement.
Only the skeleton of life remained for Pierre.
Pierre had a house.
Pierre had a brilliant wife who now enjoyed the favors of a very important personage.
Pierre had acquaintance with all Petersburg.
Pierre had court service with its dull formalities.
This life seemed unexpectedly loathsome to Pierre.

Pierre avoided the company of the Brothers.

Pierre drank a great deal.
Pierre came once more into touch with the bachelor sets.
